titles.title: To require States that receive funds under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to enact a law that requires the expulsion of students who are convicted of a crime of violence.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Youth and Families.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and the Workforce

bill.summary: 1/7/1997--Introduced. Requires States, as a condition of eligibility to receive funds under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965, to enact a law that requires local educational agencies (LEAs) to expel from school for at least one month any student convicted of a crime of violence. Permits such States to allow LEAs to provide educational services in an alternative setting to such expelled students.
